IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: SAINT LEO UNIVERSITY WELCOMES AND EMBRACES IN THE CATHOLIC BENEDICTINE TRADITION (SEE SCHEDULE O) INDIVIDUALS OF ALL FAITHS. THE UNIVERSITY SEEKS BALANCED GROWTH IN MIND, BODY, AND SPIRIT FOR ALL MEMBERS OF OUR COMMUNITY. OUR COMMUNITY RECOGNIZES THE DIGNITY, VALUE, AND GIFTS OF ALL. AT SAINT LEO, LEARNING IS OF PRIME IMPORTANCE, AND WE WORK TO MEET THE EVOLVING NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITIES AND THE WORLD AROUND US.
IRS990.MissionDesc: SAINT LEO IS AN INVENTIVE GLOBAL CATHOLIC LIBERAL ARTS UNIVERSITY THAT FOSTERS A PERSONAL & INCLUSIVE COMMUNITY WHICH EDUCATES, PREPARES, & DEVELOPS STUDENTS FOR SUCCESS, AND CONSISTS OF DIVERSE LEARNERS WHO BOLDLY CONFRONT THE CHALLENGES OF OUR WORLD THROUGH SERVICE TO OTHERS.
IRS990.Desc: AS THE OLDEST CATHOLIC INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION IN FLORIDA AND ONE OF THE TOP UNIVERSITIES IN CENTRAL FLORIDA, SAINT LEO UNIVERSITY HAS A CENTURY-LONG TRADITION OF WELCOMING STUDENTS OF ALL FAITHS. FOR MORE INFORMATION, SEE SCHEDULE O.OUR LIBERAL ARTS CAMPUS, LOCATED 30 MILES NORTH OF TAMPA, EDUCATES JUST UNDER 2,200 STUDENTS. TOTAL ENROLLMENT ACROSS OUR CENTRAL FLORIDA CAMPUS, 13 REGIONAL LOCATIONS, AND ONLINE PROGRAMS IS NEARLY 18,000. SAINT LEO OFFERS OVER 50 UNDERGRADUATE DEGREES, PROGRAMS AND ENDORSEMENTS AS WELL AS MASTER'S, DOCTORAL AND CERTIFICATE PROGRAMS IN THE COLLEGE OF ARTS & SCIENCES, COLLEGE OF BUSINESS, COLLEGE OF EDUCATION & SOCIAL SERVICES, AND THE COLLEGE OF HEALTH PROFESSIONS. A TOTAL OF NEARLY 160 PROGRAMS. THE PUBLICATION DIVERSE ISSUES IN HIGHER EDUCATION RANKS SAINT LEO AMONG ITS TOP 100 INSTITUTIONS GRADUATING MINORITY STUDENTS WITH BACCALAUREATE DEGREES. WE'RE A SMALL SCHOOL, BUT WE HAVE AN INCREDIBLY DIVERSE STUDENT BODY COMPOSED OF 41% STUDENTS FROM UNDERREPRESENTED POPULATIONS. SAINT LEO NOW SERVES STUDENTS FROM ALL 50 STATES, THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, THREE U.S. TERRITORIES AND OVER 80 FOREIGN COUNTRIES. SAINT LEO IS ALSO ONE OF THE NATION'S LEADING PROVIDERS OF HIGHER EDUCATION TO THE U.S. MILITARY.TODAY CLOSE TO 5,000 MEN AND WOMEN OF THE ARMED FORCES, VETERANS, AND THEIR FAMILY MEMBERS ARE ENROLLED IN SAINT LEO UNIVERSITY DEGREE PROGRAMS - THAT'S ABOUT ONE-THIRD OF THE UNIVERSITY-WIDE STUDENT COMMUNITY. THOUSANDS OF ACTIVE DUTY SERVICE MEMBERS, VETERANS AND FAMILY MEMBERS WORLDWIDE EARN AFFORDABLE, ACCESSIBLE UNIVERSITY DEGREES THROUGH OUR TRADITIONAL FLORIDA CAMPUS, EXTENSIVE ONLINE PROGRAM OFFERINGS AND EDUCATION CENTERS ON MILITARY BASES THROUGHOUT THE U.S. IN NOVEMBER 2014 THE NORTHEAST FLORIDA EDUCATION CENTER, ALONG WITH THE SCHOOL DISTRICT OF CLAY COUNTY (FL), WAS CHOSEN BY THE MILITARY CHILD EDUCATION COALITION AS ONE OF FIVE NATIONAL RECIPIENTS TO RECEIVE THE 2014 PETE TAYLOR PARTNERSHIP OF EXCELLENCE AWARD, WHICH RECOGNIZES SUCCESSFUL PARTNERSHIPS AND PROJECTS THAT ULTIMATELY BENEFIT MILITARY-CONNECTED CHILDREN.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: AUXILIARY ENTERPRISES OF THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDE CERTAIN CUSTOMARY SERVICES SUCH AS HOUSING, FOOD SERVICE, AND VARIOUS STUDENT ACTIVITIES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE STUDENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY. TRADITIONAL CAMPUS STUDENTS COMPRISED 2,133 FOR THE FY22 FISCAL YEAR.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.PersonNm: ABBOTT ISAAC J CAMACHO OS B

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FINE ART WORK THE MAJORITY OF THE ART WORKS ARE PRINTS BY YANDEL GINZBURG. THE ART WORK IS EXHIBITED THROUGHOUT VARIOUS CAMPUS BUILDINGS FOR THE CULTURAL APPRECIATION AND ENJOYMENT OF THE COLLEGE'S STUDENTS, EMPLOYEES AND VISITORS.

THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS FUNDS FOR THE VARIOUS STUDENT ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THE UNIVERSITY. THESE FUNDS ARE THE PROPERTY OF THE STUDENT CLUBS AND THE UNIVERSITY HOLDS THESE FUNDS UNTIL USED BY THESE ORGANIZATIONS.

ENDOWMENT FUNDS THE MAJORITY OF THE PERM ENDOWMENT IS FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING SCHOLARSHIPS. OTHER ENDOWMENTS ARE FOR ITEMS SUCH AS LIBRARY MATERIALS AND MISCELLANEOUS EXPENDITURES AS DESIGNATED BY DONORS.

THE UNIVERSITY IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(A) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AS AN ORGANIZATION DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, AS AMENDED. MANAGEMENT DOES NOT CONSIDER FEDERAL INCOME TAXES ASSOCIATED WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TO BE SIGNIFICANT. FASB ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION ASC SUBTOPIC 740-10, INCOME TAXES OVERALL, PRESCRIBES A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD AND MEASUREMENT ATTRIBUTE FOR THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT OF A TAX POSITION TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN, AND PROVIDES GUIDANCE ON DERECOGNITION, CLASSIFICATION, INTEREST AND PENALTIES, AND DISCLOSURE. THE UNIVERSITY BELIEVES THAT IT HAS APPROPRIATE SUPPORT FOR ITS TAX POSITIONS TAKEN AND AS SUCH, DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT COULD RESULT IN MATERIAL IMPACT TO THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
UNIVERSITY FUNDED SCHOLARSHIP ALLOWANCES -31,050,414.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: LINE 6 - EXPLANATION OF GOVERNMENT FINANCIAL AID
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COLLEGE PARTICIPATES IN NUMEROUS FEDERAL AND STATE PROGRAMS, WHICH ARE LISTED BELOW. THESE PROGRAMS ARE AUDITED ANNUALLY IN ACCORDANCE WITH RELATED REGULATIONS. U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION: FEDERAL PELL GRANT PROGRAM FEDERAL WORK STUDY PROGRAM FEDERAL SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANTS FEDERAL DIRECT STUDENT LOAN PROGRAM FEDERAL TEACH GRANT PROGRAM HEERF III - INSTITUTIONAL HEERF III - STUDENT HEERF III - STRENGTHING INSTITUTIONS ROBERT NOYCE TEACHER SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM GRANTS TO REDUCE DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING ON CAMPUS EDUCATION AND HUMAN RESOURCES STATE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND COMMISSIONER OF EDUCATION: FLORIDA RESIDENT ACCESS GRANT FLORIDA STUDENT ASSISTANCE GRANT FLORIDA BRIGHT FUTURES SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM MINORITY TEACHER SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM FLORIDA HONORABLY DISCHARGED GRADUATE ASSISTANCE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION ROBOTICS ENGINEERY DEGREE AND MICROCREDENTIALS PROGRAM CHILDREN OF DECEASED OR DISABLED VETERANS FLORIDA WORK EXPERIENCE PROGRAM SAINT LEO UNIVERSITY LICENSE PLATE PROJECT

DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANTS: INDIVIDUALS REQUESTING ANY FORM OF FINANCIAL AID MUST COMPLETE PERSONAL FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND IF THEY ARE DEPENDENTS, THEY MUST ALSO PROVIDE PARENTAL OR GUARDIAN FINANCIAL INFORMATION. ONLY INDIVIDUALS ENROLLED IN THE SCHOOL AT THE TIME OF DISBURSEMENTS ARE CONSIDERED FOR FINANCIAL AID. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AWARD TO STUDENTS MAY ONLY BE USED TO DEFRAY THE EDUCATION COSTS OF MATRICULATING AT THE COLLEGE. NO STUDENT MAY DFRAY SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS FOR PERSONAL MATTERS; ACCORDINGLY, THE COLLEGE DOES NOT UNDERTAKE FURTHER MONITORING ONCE THE SCHOLARSHIP IS AWARDED.

DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANTS: INDIVIDUALS REQUESTING ANY FORM OF FINANCIAL AID MUST COMPLETE PERSONAL FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND IF THEY'RE DEPENDENTS, THEY MUST ALSO PROVIDE PARENTAL OR GUARDIAN FINANCIAL INFORMATION. ONLY INDIVIDUALS ENROLLED IN THE SCHOOL AT THE TIME OF DISBURSEMENTS ARE CONSIDERED FOR FINANCIAL AID. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AWARD TO STUDENTS MAY ONLY BE USED TO DEFRAY THE EDUCATION COSTS OF MATRICULATING AT THE COLLEGE. NO STUDENT MAY DEFRAY SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS FOR PERSONAL MATTERS; ACCORDINGLY, THE COLLEGE DOES NOT UNDERTAKE FURTHER MONITORING ONCE THE SCHOLARSHIP IS AWARDED.

DURING THE YEAR, THE FOLLOWING INDIVIDUAL LIVED IN CAMPUS-OWNED HOUSING PURSUANT TO FILING ORGANIZATION'S POLICIES AND PROCEDURES: SENESE, JEFFREY: $71,160 (FMV) DURING THE YEAR, THE FOLLOWING INDIVIDUAL RECEIVED PAYMENTS FOR SOCIAL CLUB DUES: REIDY, FRANCIS: $5,340
DURING THE YEAR, THE FOLLOWING INDIVIDUALS RECEIVED SEVERANCE PAYMENTS PURSUANT TO THE FILING ORGANIZATIONS POLICIES AND PROCEDURES: PARKER, ROBYN: $194,880 HILL, KELLY: 187,895

THE PRESIDENT SUBMITS HIS BONUS RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE BASED ON WHETHER THEIR EXECUTION GOALS AND OBJECTIVES WERE MET, BASED ON KEY METRICS (COULD CHANGE YEAR TO YEAR), AND OTHER ACCOMPLISHMENTS DURING THE YEAR. THE PRESIDENT ALSO SUBMITS HIS EXECUTION GOALS, PERFORMANCE OF KEY METRICS, AND OTHER ACCOMPLISHMENTS. THEN THE PRESIDENT AND THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE MEET AND DISCUSS. AT A LATER DATE, THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE DECIDES ON EXECUTIVE BONUSES AND PROVIDES IT TO THE PRESIDENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, PART I, COLUMN F
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DESCRIPTION OF PURPOSE ON MAY 16, 2019, THE HIGHER EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES FINANCING AUTHORITY (HEFFA) ISSUED ITS REVENUE REFUNDING BONDS, SERIES 2019 IN THE AMOUNT OF $68,935,000 ON BEHALF OF THE UNIVERSITY. THE PROCEEDS OF THE BONDS WERE LOANED TO THE UNIVERSITY AND WILL BE APPLIED TOGETHER WITH OTHER AVAILABLE MONEY OF THE UNIVERSITY TO (A) FINANCE AND REFINANCE APORTION OF THE COST OF THE 2019 PROJECT (B) REFINANCE THE 2012 A & B SERIES BONDS, (C) CAPITALIZE A PORTION OF INTEREST ON THE SERIES 2019 BONDS AND (D) PAY COSTS OF ISSUANCE RELATED TO THE SERIES 2019 BONDS.
TOTAL PROCEEDS OF $77,075,069 INCLUDE PAR VALUE OF $68,935,000, PREMIUM OF $8,060,343 AND GAIN ON REDEMPTION OF INTEREST RATE EXCHANGE AGREEMENT FOR PREVIOUS BOND HOLDINGS OF $79,726.
THE NUMBER REPORTED ON PART I COLUMN (B) REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL HAVE TEN (10) MEMBERS, ALL OF WHO SHALL BE VOTING TRUSTEES, EXCEPT FOR THE PRESIDENT WHO SHALL BE EX OFFICIO WITHOUT VOTE AND NOT COUNTED AS PART OF A QUORUM FOR THE PURPOSE OF TRANSACTING BUSINESS. THE CHAIRPERSON, VICE CHAIRPERSON, AND SECRETARY SHALL BE MEMBERS ALONG WITH THE CHAIRPERSONS OF ALL THE BOARD STANDING COMMITTEES. IN ADDITION, ONE TRUSTEE SHALL BE NOMINATED BY THE COMMITTE ON TRUSTEES AND ELECTED BY THE BOARD AT THE ANNUAL MEETING TO SERVE ON THE COMMITTEE. THE CHAIRPERSON SHALL INSURE THERE IS AT LEASE ONE MEMBER OF THE BENEDICTINE COMMUNITY ON THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE PURPOSE OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE IS TWOFOLD; 1) IT SHALL SERVE AT THE PLEASURE OF THE BOARD AS ITS AGENT IN HELPING THE PRESIDENT TO ADDRESS BUSINESS MATTERS NOT OTHERWISE HEREIN SOLELY RESERVED FOR THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OR AS OTHERWISE DELEGATED BY THE BOARD BETWEEN REGULAR BOARD MEEINGS TO CONSERVE TIME; AND 2) IT SHALL ASSIST THE CHAIRPERSON AND THE PRESIDENT IN THEIR JOINT RESPONSIBILITY TO HELP THE BOARD TO FUNCTION EFFECTIVELY AND EFFICIENTLY BY SUGGESTING THE BOARD MEETING AGENDA ITEMS AND PERIODICALLY ASSESSING THE QUALITY OF COMMITTEE WORK. THE COMMITTEE SHALL HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO TAKE ACTION ON EMERGENCY MATTERS WHICH CANNOT OR SHOULD NOT BE DEFERRED UNTIL THE BOARD'S NEXT SCHEDULE MEETING. THE COMMITTEE SHALL HAVE AUTHORITY TO ACT FOR THE BOARD OF TURSTEES ON ALL MATTERES EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING WHICH SHALL BE RESERVED FOR THE BOARD; PRESIDENTIAL SELECTION AND TERMINATION; TRUSTEE AND BOARD OFFICER SELECTION; CHANGES IN INSTITUTIONAL MISSION AND PURPOSES; CHANGES TO THE BYLAWS, CHARTER, OR ARTICLES OF INCOPORATION; INCURRING OF CORPORATE INDEBTEDNESS IN EXCESS OF $250,000; SALE OF UNIVERSITY ASSETS OR TANGIBLE PROPERTY VALUED GREATER THAN $250,000; ADOPTION OF THE ANNUAL BUDGET; AND CONFERRAL OF DEGREES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DESCRIPTION OF PROCESS USED TO REVIEW FORM 990. THE BOARD WILL RECEIVE A "FINALIZED" DRAFT COPY OF THE 990 AHEAD OF THE FEBRUARY BOARD MEETINGS. DURING THE BOARD MEETING THE MANAGEMENT TEAM WILL BRIEFLY DISCUSS AND DESCRIBE THE 990 AND WILL TAKE COMMENTS AND QUESTIONS RELATED TO THE DRAFT. THE BOARD WILL GET TO VOTE ON APPROVAL, AND ONCE APPROVED, SAINT LEO UNIVERSITY WILL SUBMIT THE 990 TO THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DESCRIPTION OF PROCESS TO MONITOR TRANSACTIONS FOR CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. UNIVERSITY MEMBERS SHALL AVOID FAVORTITISM AND ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST OR APPEARANCE OF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST THROUGH THE FOLLOWING REQUIREMENTS: A. TRUSTEE DUTIES: ELEMENTS OF A CONFLICT. A TRUSTEE HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST WHENEVER THE TRUSTEE OR A FAMILY MEMBER OR A BUSINESS ASSOCIATED WITH A TRUSTEE OR A FAMILY MEMBERS (INSOFAR AS MAY BE KNOWN TO THE TRUSTEE) HAS AN EXISTING OR POTENTIAL FINANCIAL OR OTHER INTEREST IN A MATTER PENDING BEFORE THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES THAT MIGHT REASONABLY BE EXPECTED TO IMPAIR THE TRUSTEE'S INDEPENDENCE OF JUDGMENT OR OBJECTIVITY IN THE DISCHARGE OF GOVERNANCE RESPONSIBILITIES. "BUSINESS ASSOCIATES WITH A TRUSTEE" MEANS AN ORGANIZATION, CORPORATION, PARTNERSHIP, PROPRIETORSHIP OR OTHER BUSINESS ENTITY WITH RESPECT TO WHICH EITHER THE TRUSTEE OR (INSOFAR AS MAY BE KNOWN TO THE TRUSTEE) A MEMBER OF THE TRUSTEE'S FAMILY; A) RECEIVES COMPENSATION IN EXCESS OF $500 IN ANY MONTH OR HAS ANY CONTRACTUAL RIGHT TO FUTURE INCOME IN EXCESS OF $6,000 PER YEAR EXCLUDING COMPENSATION FROM THE UNIVERSITY, ANY GOVERNMENTAL SOURCE, INVESTMENT OR SAVINGS INCOME, RETIREMENT OR INSURANCE BENEFITS OR ALIMONY; B) SERVES AS AN OFFICER, DIRECTOR, PARTNER, OR EMPLOYEE; C) HOLDS A FINANCIAL INTEREST VALUED IN EXCESS OF $10,000. B. BOARD RECUSAL: IMPLICATIONS OF RECUSAL. CONFLICT OF INTEREST COMES IN MANY FORMS AND CANNOT BE AVOIDED ENTIRELY. RECUSAL ON A PARTICULAR MATTER BECAUSE OF A CONFLICT DOES NOT REFLECT ADVERSELY ON THE INVOLVED TRUSTEE, RATHER, IT IS SIMPLY RECOGNITION THAT, IN A COMPLEX AND INTERCONNECTED SOCIETY, CONFLICTS WILL OCCUR. WHEN THIS HAPPENS, RECUSAL IS NECESSARY TO ASSURE THAT A TRUSTEE'S INDEPENDENCE OF JUDGMENT IS NOT COMPROMISED, THAT THE PUBLIC'S CONFIDENCE IN THE INTEGRITY OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES IS PRESERVED, AND THAT THE UNIVERSITY'S PUBLIC MISSION IS PROTECTED. C. CONFLICT OF INTEREST AND RECUSAL PROCEDURES: REVIEW OF PROCEDURES: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF THE UNIVERSITY COUNSEL, SHALL REVIEW ANNUALLY AT A BOARD MEETING THE REQUIREMENTS AND PROCEDURES PROVIDED IN THIS POLICY. EACH TRUSTEE SHALL SIGN A RECEIPT INDICATING THE DATE THE CODE WAS RECEIVED AND ACKNOWLEDGING THAT THEY ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR READING THE CODE AND IS BOUND BY IT. TRUSTEES CAN SEEK CLARIFICATION OF THE CODE'S PROVISIONS FROM THE UNIVERSITY COMPLIANCE OFFICER. RECUSAL: A TRUSTEE MUST SELF RECUSE FROM A MATTER IF THE TRUSTEE HAS: A) ANY FINANCIAL INTEREST, DIRECT OR INDIRECT, THAT IS INCOMPATIBLE WITH THE DISCHARGE OF THE TRUSTEE'S PUBLIC DUTIES, OR B) ANY PERSONAL INTEREST, DIRECT OR INDIRECT, THAT IS INCOMPATIBLE WITH THE DISCHARGE OF THE TRUSTEE'S PUBLIC DUTIES. D. UNIVERSITY MEMBERS EXPECTED BEHAVIOR: NO EMPLOYEE SHALL HAVE ANY INTEREST, FINANCIAL OR OTHERWISE, DIRECT OR INDIRECT, OR ENGAGE IN ANY BUSINESS TRANSACTION OR PROFESSIONAL ACTIVITY, THAT IS IN SUBSTANTIAL CONFLICT WITH THE PROPER DISCHARGE OF THE EMPLOYEE'S DUTIES. E. ADDITIONAL OBLIGATIONS: TRUSTEE AND SENIOR ADMINISTRATIVE PERSONNEL HAVE A DUTY TO THE UNIVERSITY TO ALWAYS ACT IN GOOD FAITH, WITH THE CARE AN ORDINARY PERSON IN A LIKE POSIITON WOULD EXERCISE UNDER SIMILAR CIRCUMSTANCES, AND IN A MANNER REASONABLY BELIEVED TO BE IN THE BEST INTERESTS OF THE UNIVERSITY. PERSONS OCCUPYING THESE POSITIONS OF TRUST SHALL COMPLETE AND SUBMIT, ON AT LEAST AN ANNUAL BASIS, A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE FORM ("FORM"). THE FORM SHALL BE AMENDED FOR FREQUENTLY, AS NEEDED, WHENEVER THERE IS A MATERIAL CHANGE IN THE CIRCUMSTANCES OF THE REPORTING PERSON THAT WOULD MAKE THE FORM THEN ON FILE MATERIALLY FALSE OR MISLEADING. IN ADDITION, ALL TRUSTEES MUST AGREE AND SIGN A STATEMENT OF RESPONSIBILITIES ("STATEMENT") THAT WILL PROVIDE SOME GUIDANCE ON THE SPECIAL RESPONSIBILITIES ATTENDED TO THAT OFFICE. THE FORM AND THE STATEMENT MAY BE CHANGED FROM TIME TO TIME BY THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OFFICE & POSITIONS FOR WHICH PROCESS WAS USED. THE UNIVERSITY HIRES AN INDEPENDENT CONSULTANT TO REVIEW AND MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION PACKAGE BASED OFF OF INDUSTRY, TRENDS, ETC. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES DECIDES WHAT THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION WILL BE AFTER REVIEWING THE CONSULTANT'S WORK AND RECOMMENDATION. THE EXEUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES REVIEWS AND APPROVES ALL SALARIES AND BASES THEIR REVIEW ON SALARY TRENDING AND OTHER COMPENSATION RELATED INFORMATION. THE PROCESS IS USED TO ESTABLISH COMPENSATION FOR THE FOLLOWING OFFICES AND POSITIONS: UNIVERSITY PRESIDENT SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT VICE PRESIDENT OF STUDENT AFFAIRS VICE PRESIDENT OF ACADEMIC AFFAIRS VICE PRESIDENT OF BUSINESS AFFAIRS VICE PRESIDENT OF ATHLETICS VICE PRESIDENT OF STRATEGIC ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT UNIVERSITY COUNSEL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FORM 990 AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC BY RETAINING A COPY AT ITS PLACE OF BUSINESS AND PROVIDING IT UPON REQUEST. THE FORM 990 IS LIKEWISE PUBLISHED ON THE INTERNET AT WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG. THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE NOT ORDINARILY MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC, BUT, IF REQUESTED, WILL BE PROVIDED AT MANAGEMENT'S DISCRETION.
PLEDGE WRITE-OFF 104,571. CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENT -862,445.
